aldo-bender-happy-wednesdays.author: Josh
aldo-bender-happy-wednesdays.content:
Ahhhh....HAPPY WEDNESDAYS!!! Way Waaaaaay too much fun on a week night. The real deal party feel mid week. Aldo Bender and Michael Cook destroying the place. Just as good as a Saturday night. And the after parties....o man!!! The dancefloor would be packed and absolutely going off every week. To be honest this was the best weekly party of the early 90's besides Flammable Liquid in my humble estimations. Aldo Bender taking us back in this classic mix.

dj-trance-raw-live-at-what.author: Marc
dj-trance-raw-live-at-what.content:
Simfonix,

This was the first tape I ever got back in the days.  Jason handed it to me when I was 17 at DMC Records on Melrose Ave when he was working there back in 93-94.

Trance's absolute masterpiece mix!!  I can't beleive I found this again.   Lost the tape.  Some A-hole jacked it from me!  =(

  This is the most amazing moment on the internet I have ever had.  Thank you so much for giving me my favorite mix back!!!!! =)

dj-trance-raw-live-at-what.author: simfonik
dj-trance-raw-live-at-what.content: Melrose is pretty depressing these days. I remember hopping from Street Sounds (when it was upstairs with Frank C and R.A.W. working there) to DMC (with Ron D Core, Vitamin D, DJ Trance, etc..), not to mention Prime Cuts and Beat Non Stop, and spending an entire day just digging through records and chatting it up with others. Happy I could bring back some memories for you. All these mixes hold many for me so I know how you feel.

dj-trance-raw-live-at-what.author: Jay Prophet
dj-trance-raw-live-at-what.content:
I grew up in the San Fernando Valley. My Mom was a singer in a pretty popular 80s rock band. Growing up in Cali is crazy! There are so many different things going on so whatever you were into there was tons of people doing the same thing. I was 15 sitting on my front porch the time is approx 5pm,  6 hours before My life would be changed forever! The neighbor kid Lou walks up. Lou is like 18 different than anyone around there. He wore hula Hoop Jenkos and Fuct shirts, rainbow sox w toes in them, everything was always bright colors. I always thought he was cool but he was always busy and I was younger, but today was my lucky day!! He said "You should come check out this party tonight down in LA! Its gonna be sick!!" Im in!!! "Be ready around like midnight." Ok cool!! Seemed late to me but I had to go see WHAT was going on that I was missing out on. Its like 12:30 and Lou comes out of his house trippin balls "Open up!! he said 2 dancing test tubes for you!" Acid???? Oh shit I never tripped before but I been wanting too! "HAHAHA Lou laughs for like 5mins before he says "Tonight you will born in to the LA Underground, Lets go!" Were flying down the hyway, Power tools is on the radio. I heard a little Techno up to this point in my life but mostly Rap and Metal. I didnt really know what happening?? The acid kicking in alittle and my head was bobbin to some bad ass sounds and Lou boppin all around the car lol, this was the coolest time I have had so far in life!! FUCK...I really had NO idea WHAT was about to go down!!! We pull up to the top of a parking garage Lou looks at me and says" R U READY???" Im pretty sure! I was feeling like something BIG was about to happen, man that acid was just starting to hit me and F it was STRONG!!!! I feel this rumble in the air!!  WOW Im feeling that acid!! We get to the street and a line of people!!!  Damn this is a long line! Every person that goes in I am 1 step closer! The anticipation is really, really high! I ask myself WHAT is going on in there??? There I am, next in!!! I give my 5bucks to the door guy. I walk in the music is pounding. I push the tarp to the side and BAM!!!! I finally found what was missing from my life!!!! WHAT! thats right! I never looked back. That was 27 years  ago. I cant imagine life without WHAT, Family, Double Hit Mickeys, Double Dare, Om Labs, Aqua, Open House, ECT.......over the years I brought RAW aka6blocc to denver, Jason Blakemoore aka DJ Trance to the east coast. I have played and produced ever since and would not be me with out Lou RIP!!! Who remembers Circus lol the Married w Children kid? AnywaysLive Fast Dream Hard and Long Live Black Light Mafia, Enjoy!
https://soundcloud.com/subliminalcriminal303/take-you-2-the-prophet-lands

dj-trance-raw-live-at-what.author: omar
dj-trance-raw-live-at-what.content:

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey.author: Lauren
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey.content: Hey, would you agree that the winning blu mar ten riexems actually more closely adhere to blu mar ten's usual style than did their own version of the track?  Except maybe the last one in your collage.  Even though that last part was harder sounding than the original, it was slower.  Or did you slow it down to match the others?  I was thinking that maybe in these competitions you should first understand the original artist's style, and make that your foundation.  Beyond that I would bring your own style in as a texture.  I particularly liked the first version in the collage.  The warm piano is a really nice touch.Don't get me wrong, this is not about how much I like yours, because I totally do.  This is about winning the contests, which I'd like to see you do.

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey.author: Kckoll Splat
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey.content: We were fortunate to share that time together in a small tightnit dance community. I had the Family card. It made me feel special and a part of something together with good friends who came from far off places to meet together. Awesome memories.

barry-weaver-trip-train.author: Shahnam (a.k.a Shaggy)
barry-weaver-trip-train.content:
Just wanted to make a shout out to main man Josh Mclintock for showing to the Double Hit Mickey reunion -  yo kid we put a dent in hat concrete dance floor! still keeping it real brotha! It was great seeing you there.

The Sets:  Mr. Kool Aid brought it all back right after Steve LeClair. Kool 1:30AM played nothing old Hip house/Acid House. Then it was on By Ron D Core bringing it strong for all the Oldskool hardcore heads. He played nothing but Techno Classics. Then at 4AM it was Barry Weaver.........just had to be there Later. played mostly tracks from Train Trip.....enough said.  

Shaggy 8)

doc-martin-goa-aum-with-yourself.author: vic
doc-martin-goa-aum-with-yourself.content: ...was there all the way, partying, promoting, loving, consuming, groovin'...  doc's set at 808 State in September '91 & so many more thereafter... his Circa '92 set in April at the Shrine & every Flammable since '91... one of the most memorable was in a mansion downtown near Adams.  doc had put candles around his turntables, in front of bay round windows, overlooking downtown LA.  we watched the sun come up as we grooved the whole night / morning.  and how could you forget Flammable the night of the earthquake & the New Moon Cafe downtown on San Pedro (no longer there)... OMG!!!  great, greatness at it's best.

doc-martin-goa-aum-with-yourself.author: Matt Mallon
doc-martin-goa-aum-with-yourself.content: i have to thank you folks for being smart enough to keep all that stuff. i had it for years but eventually it got lost.  i had been looking for go aum wit urself for ever we had copies that eventually went to shit, i started offering people money(100s) for a copy but it seemed nobody still had a copy, great to see someone converted it to MP3.  i grew up with DJ MILKY, he played mostly the hip-hop rooms. He is clearly on the flyer for FRUITCAKE but he played GRALINES SHOES amongst others. He also played NO-DOZ at the coconut teaser for Ron D Core many times.  I still believe he was one of the first to put some of the Hip Hop stuff with techno. Obviously no knock on DJ Dan but i heard a tape where he absolutly used a mix 5-10 years after Milky had used it. It was using Ice-Ts colors over a techno beat.  keep posting that stuff and we who were there will keep reliving it. THANKS again!!!!!!!!!!!

118bpmish....yeah
 Me likey. 

Earth to Sea at Princes club was my entry to the All night Doc experience. Man he played all night. 8-10 hrs straight.

The only reason I was there was because I met a kick ass girl at No Doz. She invited me to Doc's afterhours. Her name was Kitty. 
Great memories. She had a friend named Rambo and lived in Inglewood at the time.

Fantastic times and memories.

jon-bishop-techno-mix-92.author: Nicole
jon-bishop-techno-mix-92.content:
"p>im looking for the name of a dj(and maybe where to find) from a tape a buddy had circa 1998.  It was an clear, orange colored tape.  I thimk it was monkey business"
AntB420... That translucent orange cassette your talking about is called "FOUR" and it's by DJ Jon Bishop!  It was my first mix from him and I only picked it for its cool color!  I have many of his cassettes  ( lol) and a few of his first CD's .  I just told him on FB how STRIKE and Four are my favorite all time techno/house mixes...I still play it a few times in my car. It's awesome highway driving music! Ask Jon if you can buy a copy and if he can't do it maybe I could find a cassette to CD player somewhere on this Earth and make you a copy!  LOL

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Frank
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content: Sue Dread (host)anyone know where she is today Good People.Oh How  I Miss Those Early 90s Kicking it at Doc's pad in the Hollywood Hills after the club. We Were So Lucky to have been in the scene back when the vibe was so Fresh "Jive"...Beat non Stop till ya drop..We All just got a time machine with all this underground classics bring it back way back Thanks a million for all the dope mixes i wish i could give back some of my tape collection but there long gone...

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Julie
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content: Sue is still around. She throws Balance at King King in Hollywood, twice a month. I first met her at Happy Wednesdays on the Redondo Beach pier a million years ago. 1991 or 92. Anyone else go?

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Jason Splat
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content:
Happy Wednesdays, I was there and at Citrusonic. 
We'd go out almost every night of the week:

Tuesdays- was Exxon in downtown, 
Wed- Citrusonic, 
Thursdays- Joy at the Troubador or Happy House OC,
Fridays More afterhours, Sat RAVES then Flammable Liquid. 
Family Groove at the Shark club was in there somewhere too.
Sunday- Sketch Pad! 

SHEESH- how did I survive? 
Oh I know- I was really young!

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: '92 rare techno-house with rave stabs.. - tuneID.com
Josh McClintock
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content: TZ-3 Jason

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Julie
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content: Oh man, I almost forgot about Joy at the Troubador. I always did Sunday Love too.  Otter Pops!!  :)

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Ryan
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content:
I remember Happy Wednesdays. I met Rudy there and next day he introduced me to Sue. Great people!
Julie: Sue is still around. She throws Balance at King King in Hollywood, twice a month. I first met her at Happy Wednesdays on the Redondo Beach pier a million years ago. 1991 or 92. Anyone else go?

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Ryan
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content: Your not the Julie that used to hang out with Carlos (Cindy) are you?

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Ryan
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content: This was actually from a blank tape i through in recorder upstairs that night.  I made a couple copies for some friends.  Guess they made a couple copies, and so on...

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Julie
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content: Yup, that would be me. :)

doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.author: Josh
doc-martin-live-at-citrusonic.content: Doc laying down a heavy breakbeat set at Citrusonic!! So dope!! He really only played that style for a couple years. I love how at the 23:00 minute mark on side one (if you listen closely) you can hear that the needle picked up the crowd downstairs on the dancefloor going off.  I bet Frank Ramirez or Randy J could help spot a few tracks on this one.

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Dj ROCKIT
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: I used to go to these parties back in the day in Sacramento. They were great. I believe this one went down in the basement of a downtown Sacramento building off of 10th street.

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: DJ Dewada(A Ruiz)
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: Wish I could here Ernie Munson again, had great memories w/ him on the decks! In LA and SF.  He use to JAM!

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Josh from NY
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: Last track on side 2 is Lock Groove- Feel the Joy

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Thanks for uploading this Lou!
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content:
This was either late '93 or '94, can't remember.  By the looks of the cassette, I recorded that off DAT for Ernie...  how's you get a copy, Lou?  LOVING it.

FYI, at Wicked I found out that Ernie's been in the UK for a number of years now.

The downtown location you speak of Rudy was the basement of the Capital Plaza Towers.  Loved that sweaty, spring loaded dance floor amidst the secret underground storage tunnels!

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Thanks for uploading this Lou!
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: BTW, that was me on the previous comment.  Didn't know how to put my name on here.... lol

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Thanks for uploading this Lou!
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: Damn; lol!  Still can't get that name thing!  It's Peter Fable'.  Frank Gomez, Chris Burkes and I were Ooga Booga.  Cheers!

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Jeff Jolley
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: Those were the days for sure! When is the reunion Peter?

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: John Relles
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: Memory of Chris Burkes!

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Billy
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content:
Yo, Peter!  It's Billy Mitchell.  I always had a blast at your parties and enjoyed playing them too!  Do you have a DAT of any of my sets from your parties?  Would love a copy.  ;)

Hope all is well!

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Filip
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: Yeah, sweet mix! This was right around the time of my first Ooga Booga party.. something magical about those daze.. ooga booga, combined with wicked full moons, and sunset parties... where did it all go?

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: sam
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: it's all still happening, in one way or another.  lots of dubstep and playa dust now.  warehouses with broadband internet access.  goggles, steampunk and fire fire fire.

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Jeffrey Tice
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: Ernie recently returned here to San Francisco.

ernie-munson-ooga-booga.author: Josh McClintock
ernie-munson-ooga-booga.content: I had an excellent listen to this mix. Especially the second side. Got schooled on that "Nation of Noiz - Xes Noiz" which lead me to a nice re-issue available that also has "Lockgroove - Feel the Joy" on it as well that I decided to splurge on. Sick. Nice spot!!  I'm also extremely pleased with myself for spotting  Redux - Da-Da Dancing (Part 1) at 14:00 on Side 2. It's an old Peter Daou record that has quite a few interesting tracks on it. I had completely forgotten about it but I knew I used to have it. "Redux" suddenly popped in my head and I looked it up. Pretty sure I bought that one off of Doc at Prime Cuts.

jason-bently-oct-92.author: Herb
jason-bently-oct-92.content: DJ Sonic!! I remember staying up until 1:30am to record his shows, and still have those recordings.

jason-bently-oct-92.author: Jason Splat
jason-bently-oct-92.content:
I stayed up religiously to record the Illicit groove every friday.. I have some tapes still from that show.. 

Dj Sonic taught me so much about underground dance music. I appreciated his diverse sets that showed the bigger picture: all the possibilities of EMD.

jason-bently-oct-92.author: Jason Splat
jason-bently-oct-92.content:
woah this one is pretty much all deep house.. 
trippy considering how his radio sets seemed moved more into the hardcore/ breakbeat stuff years later.

jason-bently-oct-92.author: blakemore
jason-bently-oct-92.content: i went to LMU at the same time as dj sonic and i have a few tapes (somewhere!) that i recorded from illicit groove on kxlu w/ him talking in between sets.  they are dope!  will find and send  JB

jason-bently-oct-92.author: James.exe
jason-bently-oct-92.content: I really hope you find more Jason Bentley Mixes,  These mix is classic hotness.

jason-bently-oct-92.author: Herb
jason-bently-oct-92.content: I'm in the process of posting 9 shows, that span from April of 91 to Oct of 91....Making copies to donate here as well.

jason-bently-oct-92.author: hazey
jason-bently-oct-92.content: I grew up in Victorville, CA, and somehow one radio picked up KXLU perfectly.  Illicit Groove, and We Came From Beyond kept me awake many weekends.    Good memories of exciting new musics.

chris-hyde-milk-cookies.author: Chris Hyde
chris-hyde-milk-cookies.content:
Dang! I've been looking for my own tape forever!!! I'm glad you guys have it posted, grateful...
I'll shoot you the track listing after downloading, completely forgot what's on it. It's been that long. Mike Messex did the artwork, commissioned by Orlando Puerta of Citrusonic; it went on the same press run with Steve Loria's "Deep Space" mix-tape. They both were released at the same time. -CH

chris-hyde-milk-cookies.author: Chris Hyde
chris-hyde-milk-cookies.content: I'm still looking for "Xperience", "Icarus" and "For The People"... -CH

chris-hyde-milk-cookies.author: John
chris-hyde-milk-cookies.content:
I forgot that this inspired me.  After hearing this, I had to go out and get the 2 tracks I loved the most.  2 tracks that I would still play to this day are, "house of nice" & "Reyna page", cookie side.
Thanks for posting this.
John

doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.author: Josh McClintock
doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.content:
Wuzzzup  Scott! Excellent id's..thank you buddy! Dude...I have a story which could maybe give you a little info in hunting down the track. 
   I was over at Doc's house buying records in the early 2000's and he was showing me some old recs and he goes..."oh yeah do you want this one? It's on one of my old tapes and people have been asking about it but if you dont want it I'm just gonna bury it." I listened to the track...recognized the sample and the tune....but wasnt really into it.. (I already had a huge stack of records and I was starting to have to be picky.) So I passed on it....<<<idiot. hahaha But another thing I remember though..and the important part..it was from a compilation. I remember Doc also saying it was a very rare comiplation. 
   Anyways...maybe that will help. I totally understand the hunt dude!!! I'm still on the search for a bunch of missing tunes. Discogs and Youtube sure have helped though for sure! Definitely gamechangers.

Also, I played  the terrace at Halloreena San Diego Sports Arena....werent u my partner for their 92 event. Ok, 3 ?s to answer here...look forward to your response!

doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.author: SCOTT ALLEN from San Diego
doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.content:
This set is the one that made me think and understand. A couple of phrases I've used over the past 15 years to describe Doc:

1) He made me become a dj
2) Describing any set of his: When Doc walked, you walked, when Doc ran, you ran. (always a visual journey)
3) Doc can take any 20 records and play them in the exact order that they should be played.
4)Doc never played a straight line, but rather a gradual rollercoaster.
5) Doc is the difference between a good dj and a GREAT dj!
6) Live @ Citrusonic was a mix where Doc took you by the hand and guided you thru the tunnel all the way to the end.
7) When I get my chance, I will take you thru a journey.

I have bassed every mix I've made as a now 24 year dj, on his style. Its a template for me, and has been for the others worth mentioning. "Take people for a ride" .Listen to your records, then make sense of them, understand their connotation, and play them in a way that makes the most impact! I speak very humbly as there are a million djs better than me. BTW, anyone readin this should listen to Josh McClintock's mixes....he understood mixing as I feel defines a great dj!

doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.author: Nature Boy
doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.content:
Hey doods,

FYI The artist on Side B #17 is Charvoni.

While we're on the subject of Doc's expertise, I have a story to relate...

In the summer of 1993, Doc played an outdoor festival near Whistler, B.C. called "Summer Love" (I've uploaded a video of this party on Youtube, if you want, search "Whistler Summer Love"). The morning after the party, I drove Doc and some other folks back to the city. At some point in the drive, I asked him how things were on the main stage where he played, having spent most of my night at the smaller stage. He responded, "Good. I had that whirlpool thing happening, which was cool." This was followed by silence, as I'm sure everyone in the car was thinking the same thing as me: "What the hell is he talking about?!" 

To this day I still wonder what he meant. Is this another level of deejaying? Anybody got any ideas??? : P

doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.author: Josh McClintock

Scott, thank you for the kind words buddy! Unfortunately I don't know any more of the tracks on there...but If I come across it of course I will post it up here. This is a historic tape and it would be really cool to ID all the tracks. 
   As far as the "whirlpool thing"...hahaha yes Nature Boy...that is some other worldly language that Doc is speaking there!!! I cant tell you how many times Doc has taken me into another dimension...maybe the "whirlpool thing" has something to do with that? lol

doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.author: Josh McClintock
doc-martin-deep-urban-breakdown.content: Scott..man I had some really fun times in San Diego. '92-'94. But man, I can't remember hardly anybody I was working with cause I didnt go down that often. It's all very blurry...but I do remember having an absolute blast every time I went down and everyone  being extremely nice. I agree with your words about Doc...definitely a rollercoaster!! Doc was very inspiring to me as well! Take care dude! Check out my mixes on Soundcloud! Are you on there? Also , check out Nature Boy's channel on YouTube. He has some awesome tracks posted!

dj-curious-the-darkside-part-1.author: nate from LA - soundsdistilled
dj-curious-the-darkside-part-1.content: this WAS the tape set that got me into jungle, no doubt about it. not only the mood it created but the songs themselves. i had no idea exactly what kinda monster record hunter it would create but give it up to Curious (and Adam who played them for me!), my life changed with these tapes. started with a hunt to find these tracks (turns out many were from one LP which was obviously used in abundance to make these mixes) and then gravitated over to 93-95 ragga jungle. but hearing this brings that feeling back into the center of my gut like i just ate something thats gonna make my night a blast. ;)

doc-martin-vibratory-energy.author: Hans
doc-martin-vibratory-energy.content:
I love "toenee' gee's " comment above. That is the atmosphere that signified the LA Underground scene (before it became "the rave scene). I remember my first one was in February of 91... Some small venue that I can't remember the name of, but we left after a couple hours and went to the bigger Willy Wonka's.
The Paw Paw Patches were the bomb. Davin rocked the scene for a long time at the Casa with those. So many memories in the early days at the Casa. If there ever was a "regular" venue for the scene in the early days I think the Casa was it.
I can remember going in and seeing people from every color, tribe, and nation... white, black, hispanic, asian, gangbangers, you name it... but everyone just groovin' and getting along.

House music, and electronica in general, transcends all of those barriers that we erect between ourselves.

doc-martin-vibratory-energy.author: Josh McClintock
doc-martin-vibratory-energy.content: Well said Hans and Toenee! The Casa.....So many good times there! ESP,TRON,PIPI'S PLAYHOUSE,PAW PAW PATCH.etc etc..If you couldnt find the map point in '91...just go to the Casa.Just dont leave anything valuable in your car.lol

doc-martin-vibratory-energy.author: Hans
doc-martin-vibratory-energy.content:
Josh, I remember ALL of those and so many more. Pipi's... Wow. Yeah, the Casa was in the hood. What was it... Washington and Hill or something crazy like that?

Synergy was a great party there.

Then you bail and hit Flammable... then Sketch Pad... good times.

eli-star-omega.author: Synthetrix
eli-star-omega.content:
Good to see my old art for this mixtape after so many years.

Some of the songs on this tape include;
Age Of Affordable Retina  by Drome
Makarian 231 by Alien Signal
Like A Motorway by St. Etienne (Chemical Brothers Mix)
Out Of Control by Robert Leiner
Hermaphrodite / N.A.S.A. Nocturnal Audio Sensory Awakening by Jam & Spoon

eli-star-omega.author: Eli Star
eli-star-omega.content:
WoW!! Thanks for this blast from the past. I appreciate the kind words too.

And, how cool to see the old artwork from Synthetrix, too! Oh, the good old days, where do they go?

I've had so many people ask about the old mixes and I certainly don't have them any more. Now, I can point them to your great website.

spun-josh-come-unity-1.author: Mike
spun-josh-come-unity-1.content: I really loved Spun’s intro to these tapes (Was that Dan Rather doing some of the reporting?) I wasn’t really that into the rest of it, I even recall the Jeno tapes having a few trainwrecks, but these are the tapes that sold me on SF. These are the tapes that woke up that voice in my head that said “You need to figure out a way to get up to the Bay Area and stay up in the Bay Area for as long a spossible.”

spun-josh-come-unity-1.author: Kris Fuentes
spun-josh-come-unity-1.content: I remember this series of mixed tapes when I was in high school. Some may not be mixed to the tee but this was a new way of musical progression or house style that spoke to me; until Jeno's Inside The Mind came out & inspired me to DJ! Loved all these S.F. DJs from Ernie Munson on up. Personally I dig the Spun sd. A better. Peace and Love.

spun-josh-come-unity-1.author: Kris Fuentes
spun-josh-come-unity-1.content:
Oops, I remember these series of mixed tapes when I was
just out of high school. Some may not be mixed to a tee but it was a new way, a musical progression or house style that spoke to me; but it was Jeno's Inside The Mind that really inspired me to DJ! Loved all the these S.F. DJs from Erie Munson on up! Personally, I dig the Spun sd.A better on this first first one. Peace and Love.

jon-williams-live-at-dream.author: Zak
jon-williams-live-at-dream.content:
This tape is dope.  Relentless is the right word, for sure.

Jon Williams was among the most underrated DJs active in California in the early and mid-90s.  He was really the only guy around playing full on techno in the Jeff Mills mode.  Though his mixing skills were not at the level of Mills or other Detroit greats, his sound was all muscle, no fat, and deeply trippy.  He blew my mind on several occasions.

jon-williams-live-at-dream.author: Matt From Chicago
jon-williams-live-at-dream.content: This is a Message to the Person who posted All these fine rave relics here...  There is a page on Mixcloud - his User name is AnMRecsLA and he has more of these awesome "Live at Dream" tapes posted to his Page on there including a great one by Farina and Jenö. The same guy I mentioned above - his name is Anthony btw He most likely can help you in identifying what's on the full night, if that is the problem. He's Real Informative about these tapes and really Loves to talk about this stuff but anyway..........It's so Nice to see this site stays up where all the rest have gone down..... This music is absolutely timeless and these files are some of the best stuff that can still be found online for DL these days - I took all of these fine sets long ago plus all the dj dan stuff which All seems to be gone now ?? Wtf ?!... Peace from Chicago, Matt Williams

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: MILKTOAST
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content:
I just wanted to point out how IMPORTANT it is to find and perserve the MILKY WAY TAPES.
Basically they are an AUDIO HISTORY account of the EARLY L.A. Acid House and Rave Scene.(mid 1990 to early 1992)

These "MilkyWay Rave Tapes" were basically Live Recordings made by the MilkyWay guys, of  the original DJ's mixing at the early RAVE  parties.

These tapes were the only way back then for "ravers" to listen to TECHNO and their favorite songs(over and over and over).
There were soo many good songs before the age of the MIX TAPE in 1992,'Hot Lemonade' is a very early example.

So much music and long gone DJ's are contained in the MilkyWay collection.L.A.'s Recorded History lost to Time and to CD's
.
I've been all over the internet searching for hours and countless hours,but to ooooono avail.I may have found a copy of a copy of Steve Loria Live at Ahknahten.
I will send it as soon as i have it,Yea.
MILKTOAST

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Josh from NY
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content:
The first tapes I was able to take home with me were given to me by Mr Buzz of Acid Hits Mix Tapes in early 91' I have not seen his mixes on ANY oldschool L.A. site...and thats a damn shame. They are FANTASTIC.Ron D Cores "Hot Lemonade" tapes came home next. And then this "Milky Way" tape right here. The whole Milky Way series is outstanding. I have a Steve Leclair Milky tape as well as a  Moon Pup that arent posted. 
  Historically this is a fantastic tape. Doc playing all the techno classics....when's the last time you heard him do that? Some of the mixes are offbeat but the vibe that it sends out is sick. Definitely L.A. '91.

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Justin Thyme
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content:
In response to Josh's comment.  I spent two years in SF from 1989-1991.  I was at the first two full moon raves under the Golden Gate bridge with the Wicked Sound System.  I had tapes from Marky, Jeno & Doc.  When I moved back to NYC in 1991 I met Joeski & gave him all the tapes that I had in my collection.  I gave them to Joeski because I thought he'd really dig them.
In fact, when I moved to SF in 1989 & met Doc Martin, I had just passed through about 6 or 7 years at the Paradise Garage & had a ton of Larry Levan mixtapes & some really great WBLS-FM by Bobby Konders.  I gave  all of my tapes to Doc & Marky.  Gee, when I met Doc he wasn't even spinning house.  He was spinning Janet Jackson & Digital Underground.  I guess he got schooled real quick.  God bless Doc Martin.  He's an important bridge between the classic Garage sound & the next wave of West Coast Rave.

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Justin Thyme
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content: I would like to offer an insight after hearing Larry Levan spin for a number of years.  Larry Levan WAS the history of Dance Music every Saturday night.  He would play classic Soul & Funk from the early 70's, then move on to the classic Disco era sound & then on to the House era mixed with New Wave & Rap.  My point here is to demystify dance music a little.  There would be no House music if there wasn't first a James Brown or an Aretha Franklin.  Larry would spin "Green Onions" or "Rock Steady" or "Love Is The Message" every week.  Why?  Respect for the track.  Just a friendly reminder to respect the roots of the culture too.  A lot of DJ's are far removed from the original spirit of the early days of the DJ movement.

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Josh from NY
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content:
Wooooo 6 or 7 years at the Paradise Garage! Respect bro! Why you give away all your tapes!? And those first Wicked parties musta been out of this world. 
  Yes Mr Levan had a HUGE part in the beginnings of dance music (and LUCKY you to be a part of that)! Also dont forget about Ron Hardy at the Music Box in Chicago. Even though I never got to see him live I have heard live recordings and he inspires to this day.
   Much respect Justin...take care dude!

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Justin Thyme
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content: Hey Josh.  Why did I give away my tapes?  I gave them to Doc Martin.  He knew what to make of the tapes that I gave him!  I would say that I did the world a favor giving my Garage mixtapes to Doc.

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Josh from NY
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content:
So what your saying is that the Larry Levan mixtapes you gave Doc inspired him in those early years to become the DJ he is today? 
 Did you make copies of the tapes? I still dont understand why you gave the tapes away.....lol. Obviously you love the music...why would you give it away?

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Justin Thyme
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content: You don't see anyone but me saying that I gave my Garage Mixtapes to Doc.  You could say that I was an influence on Doc about the subject of House Music.  I don't think there was anyone at that moment who had more information in their hands then I did circa 1989.  In fact, Doc handed me a mixtape that he had done & asked me for my opinion.  His mix had so many train-crashes on it that I could only offer a Larry Levan mix to show him what a good mixer sounded like.  Does that make sense?

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Mike Paris
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content: I created, recorded, edited, mastered & distributed each and every one of  "The Milky Way Rave Recordings" I recorded 30 different sessions, reflection the very best in early LA Acid House. I am so... glad that so many of you still enjoy what we created back in the old skool days. At Milky Way Recordings I always tried to capture the excitement of the best of the best in DJ live sets.

doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.author: Josh from NY
doc-martin-teknotronic-dance-mixes.content:
I listened to the beginning of side A on all 3 of my Hot Lemonade tapes...these 3 tracks were the first track on each tape 
Space Trax - Atomic Playboy
Cybersonic - Technarchy
An unknown ambient track then 6 Bells All - Me the Mailman
Ring any bells? Sorry no Anastasia  These tapes are originals but most likely dubbed pretty far down the line as the sound quality is very poor. If you need me to I can fast forward to side 2 and see what those sides start with. I'm almost positive that there were 4 different tapes...I believe they were given out as a promotion for a party on July 12th 1991. 
  I just came upon a small utility box that I've had in storage since '96 containing about a hundred mixtapes that I had collected from '91 to '96. The 3 Hot Lemonades were part of this collection. 
  As for the 4th tape....maybe somebody else could help out. I'm planning on sending these and a few others in to Simphonik to make them available for your listening pleasure.

markem-x-live-at-dub-6-9-94.author: Jonathan
markem-x-live-at-dub-6-9-94.content: Wow!  Where the heck did this come from?!  What would you call this -- proto-breakbeat? Obscure-as-hell San Fran deep house?  Cryptic dark Detroit electro? I'm not totally sure about anything other than being glad I punched "Markem X" into Google tonight.  What ever happened to that guy?  He seemed to disappear and never did the perma-DJ-touring thing like most of the other L.A. guys did... hmmm.

markem-x-live-at-dub-6-9-94.author: Nathan Christensen
markem-x-live-at-dub-6-9-94.content:
I hung out with Markem back around 1994 when he came to Las Vegas. I remember it was in some little tiny bar with like 12 people in there. DJ Shoe, DJ Grover  and myself (all three of us were Las Vegas's first underground DJ's) we're chilling showing eachother tracks we had and I had mentioned that I was really into slow breaks and some next level shit and Markem says "hey I think I know what kind of stuff you're into" and next thing you know he busts out these jaw dropping cuts that (by his and my estimation we're for the average listeners at that time). After he mixed up some trax for me he handed me a tape which had most of these trax on them. I lost the tape through all my moved but I remember exactly what was on the "A SIDE" 

Here's what it mostly consisted of :

1.	Axis - Rolling With Rai (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EPpPljndLjE) 
2.	Unique 3 – Weight for the Bass (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zqJ78DQczaU) 
3.	Anoesis - Hemispheres (Part 1) (I couldn’t find the right version on Youtube)
4.	Micro & Vicious Vic -  Annihilating (Dark Break Mix) (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y2VmCgDGpAY )
5.	Southside Reverb - Reverberation (Neusonic Melodic Remix)( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKw-jRMA0dQ) 
6.	Pizzaman – Trippin on Sunshine (Playboys Fully Loaded Dub) I think this is the one (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YSRcE789mmM&playnext=1&list=PL67875E2D997417CE)
7.	Colorblind - You're Gonna Make Me Love Somebody Else (Jon Dasilva Mix)( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pQjsnwU3cnQ) 
8.	Little Axe - Ride On (Fight On) (Skip - Mask Mix) (I couldn’t find the right version on Youtube)

Enjoy! Nathan Christensen

keoki-let-the-street-speak-trance-dreamt.author: Virgil
keoki-let-the-street-speak-trance-dreamt.content:
Man, What a trip! keoki never disappoints, his productions are stunning I'm thinking that less of 100 of these babys were made making it quite valuable for Keoki collectors this tape is quite odd in my opinion, since It's classic trance based and keoki usually focused on techno and acid house at that time. also I'm surprised that it was released in the U.S since trance music is mainly produced in Germany and trance releases were very few in U.S with the majority of them being a combination of techno beats and atmospheric pads. but it's old so it was common to be techno influenced


I wonder if what records did he included on the mix..

eli-star-see-without-eyes.author: Burke
eli-star-see-without-eyes.content:
Hey, you guys are awesome for assembling the partial track list above.  Much appreciated!  I’m a bit late to the party & only discovered Eli Star a few years ago, but I love most of his tapes.  They’re all incredible. 

If anyone sees this at some point & can identify the third track in on side A, I’d love to know what it is.  It starts at like 11:55 & it’s the one that opens with the Flower Duet sample, and then moves into some chanting.  If this helps at all, this song also appears on a tape called ‘Kiss the Sky’ by Thomas Michael.  He uses it as the opener on side B.  Thanks!

dj-trance-los-angeles.author: tiphany

dj-trance-los-angeles.author: Nikki
dj-trance-los-angeles.content: I also had his mixed tape.  I forget if I bought it at a rave or underground music store.   I was 20 or 21 years old.  It was by far my favorite!  I constantly played it in my car.  He definitely had a different quality to his music.  I loved it.  Now I'm going to have to dig around in some old boxes and see if I possibly have that tape hidden somewhere.  Thanks for your blog about this great DJ.

mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.author: Pedro808
mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.content: Thank you. After this gig "underground" went bigtime and "rave" was born at least in LA.

mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.author: Josh McClintock
mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.content: What a party this was! And in LONG BEACH! 808 State rocked it proper....and when we thought they had played there last song...what's this?..Bjork comes on stage and does OOPS with them. Place went crazy. Steve Koolaid was my favorite DJ my first year in the scene. Feb '91 Like Pedro said on another post, he laid down an awesome vibe and played killer tracks but his mixing wasn't the greatest. Another reason I liked him so much was that he would let me carry his records in and I didnt have to pay...lol He threw some of the best parties in Southern California.....Mickey's Holy Water Adventure...Apocalypse...a bunch more I cant remember(most of them at the Casa)..lol Much respect to Steve Koolaid.

mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.author: Hans
mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.content: @Jason Huddleston... I know exactly what you mean. My first party was Eve of Love in some shabby little warehouse in DT LA in Feb of 91. Interesting, I met one of my best friends at my first party (we're still friends to this day even though we live in different states). We left Eve to go to Willy Wonka's. That was an epic event for my first "night out" and they had smashed a hole in the brick wall of this warehouse and had a slide where you could go from the main room into the disco room (yes, back then they didn't have chill rooms, they have 70's disco rooms with dayglo paint, etc.)

mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.author: Ronski G.
mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.content: I own an original copy of this Milky Way tape.  My copy has the exact same album art featured on one side with Mr. Kool-Aid, but the opposite side says "DESTRUCTO".   Is this recording all Mr. Kool-Aid on both sides, or is the B-Side actually Desctructo?  Anyone know?   I was at this Rave, but it was so long ago that I can't recall.    Thanks.

mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.author: Josh McClintock
mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.content: Interesting Ronski. I'm pretty sure it's all Steve Kool Aid from the record selection and the mixing style. I was there too! Destructo and Steve are still around. Maybe somebody that knows them could have them answer the question. Just an absolutely epic party!!!

mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.author: Josh McClintock
mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.content: Hans! Dude, I'm pretty sure I met you one time in '92 at a Flammable Liquid Party. We were chilling with our friends having a really cool conversation about the scene and the music.  I remember having this conversation because in the first place ..it was inspiring and I could tell that you were very passionate about the music.  I'd seen you at other parties before that and other parties after that, and I could tell you were there cause you loved it as much as I did.  I also remember this conversation because after this party my buddy Chris and I scored the best waves of our lives in Newport Beach!!! It was 4 to 6ft and just perfect. I still dream about those barrels to this day haaha!!! So much good music then so much good waves...just might have been the best day of my life! lol  Just a memory that's been kicking around in my brain for a couple decades...thought I'd share. Take care bro.

mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.author: Ron
mr-kool-aid-live-from-808-state-rave.content: I remember 808 state very well in the LBC...Whats up Josh, Damn Hans I haven't seen you in so many years....Willy Wonka, Surprised you remember that lol...Hope to see you again soon..Both of you!! Give me a call Josh. Haven't talked to you sense you moved back to CA. Hope all is well Bro.

moonpup-this-is-moonpup.author: Dj moonpup
moonpup-this-is-moonpup.content: I would like to say... well spotted.... I do belief this mix was created on reel to reel 4 track.... I was working for KROQ and POWER 106 doing late night mixes and I had a 4 track teac my dad gave me..... It was fun times, but yes I tried to always put out nothing but perfect mixes etc with my name on it ..... Didn't always succeed, but this was a fun mix and I was in an era of creativity and competitiveness that helped push me to become a better DJ Ultimately !!    Most of these records sadly I no longer have due to my constant moving from city to city, country to country.... but like Jim Morrison once said after being told he'd never play the Ed sullivan Show again, ... I Just played the Ed Sullivan Show !!!  LOL !!    I have all these old mixes to share as they represent my contribution to the rave culture and evolution of music throughout my life and many of yours....  I am honored to have touched so many more people than I ever imagined  !!  I am truly blessed and Im not even religious....  DJ Moonpup

moonpup-this-is-moonpup.author: Josh McClintock

doc-martin-flammable-liquid-11-91.author: Hans
doc-martin-flammable-liquid-11-91.content:
Man, what can I say? Flammable, of ALL of the parties, was the uber fly place. The vibe and people there just kicked. It was really the cream of the crop. I remember the flammable bead necklace with the logo pendant even!

Even when the commercialism hit the scene a bit after Mars FM came out, Flammable still maintained the true LA Underground vibe. Sketch Pad was pretty tight, too!

Oh yeah, I can listen to his live remix of Feel It over and over and over and over again. Anyone who's spun vinyl before can "read" exactly what he's doing with a Feel It record on each deck. BOMB STUFF.

What's the name again of the track that comes right after Feel It? That track was, and still is, epic. I used to have it on vinyl... just can't remember the name. I wanna say "Acid" something...

After hours parties were ALWAYS the best.

doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.author: Kitty
doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.content: At last. This is why I bought my $60 ticket, and to this day remember this event as if it were yesterday. After a 90 minute drive, I got stuck on the Long Beach expressway and arrived at the dock just in time to wave goodbye to the boat as it sailed off to Catalina. An absolutely distraught young lady next to me on the Pier of Gloom explained how incomprehensible a tragedy this situation was and begging me to join her in locating a rowing boat (and heaving off in the wake of a fully-revved engine) reinforced this by repeating "There is NO WAY I CAN'T BE THERE, I MUST BE THERE" for the next five minutes. Then I drove back to LA, got lost, and eventually slept for the next 14 hours. 'ardcore, me.

doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.author: Daniel King
doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.content:
My brother (Raffi) was at this rave and sent me the tape to London. Doc was always blinding on the decks and still rocks today. Trying to get some track ID's on the B side of the Gilligans Island tape. Anyone want to try and give it a go? Would like the whole thing if possible but if not than the very first track, the one at 15mins with vocals going Ahemm, Ahaa. Raga tune at 18 mins, and the track near the end with "I just can't stop" vocal.

I have already identified Black Box's "Everbody, Everbody" and Saint Etiene "7 Ways to love"

Good times - never forgotten!

And one last thing! Anyone know the track on the Gilligans A side around 14 mins with the vocals "you've got to elevate your mind, elevate your body, elevate your soul, let the rhythm take control"?

doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.author: Buster Brown
doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.content: Will always remember this event.  As a DJ from the Eastside, I saw firsthand the  first or one of the first "Raves"  in Los Angeles.  I went with my girlfriend at that time and my cousins.  We started our adventure taking the first boat out with Michael Cook and Doc.  Realized a guy I would party with from Walnut,  was on the same boat  with a good size tank full  of "nitro".    I remember MTV filming as we  headed to Catalina.  ( I can't  wait to see that footage!  I also had that segment on VHS, but recorded over it somehow). Do any of you remember that couple getting arrested for doing the do on the dance floor ?

doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.author: Josh
doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.content:
I was on the first boat too!! Do you remember the locals yelling at us as we got off the boat with signs and shit?? I later found out that they actually tried to bust the party but didn't have enough police on the island to stop a riot so they let it go. 
  I do remember the couple getting busted. The girl was underage and the guy did some jail time from what I heard.  
  I was interviewed for MTV and actually turned up in their footage that was run with Kurt Loder a couple times. I had a copy of it too but my ex girlfriend taped something over it. @#$$!!! I tried contacting MTV and they told me it was probably destroyed when they moved their offices years ago. There have been several people on here that say they have it..including the people that threw this party...but when pressed..nope.  Recently Steve Koolaid told me he might have it. My last hope. I would seriously pay someone a good amount of money to have the footage posted up. 
   I've said it before and I will say it again ....the absolute best party I've ever been too.

doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.author: Devlin Gormally

doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.author: Buster Brown
doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.content: I don't remember the issue with the locals.  One of the things I do remember was getting a taxi from the dock to the hall, and the "nitro guy " from Walnut gave  the taxi driver a couple of nitro balloons as our fair.  The "nitro guy" end up going to jail for a while.  He was released the next morning.  He told me he saw the guy who got arrested for the dance floor. Incident.   According to the flyer, that I still have, it seems that it was boat 2 that I was on with Doc, Michael and Moon Pup.  I especially remember the morning on the beach when I first heard Doc play "The Sun Rising" (Mood Mix) by The Beloved.  Good times!  I hope Koolaid posts that footage.  It will be great to see again.

doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.author: Buster Brown
doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.content: Recently I encountered a retired Sheriff who claimed to have lived on Catalina during the 90's.  I took a chance and asked if he remembered any raves that might have took place while he was there.  He responded, ""Gilligan's"   I said,  "I was there!"  He told me he was on patrol that night.  He also new about the couple on the dance floor.  He told me the locals tried to stop  "Gilligan's" from happening.  Small world.  Pedro88!  Keep us posted when that documentary comes out.  I hope Wade posts the MTV footage on YouTube.

doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.author: Josh McClintock
doc-martin-live-at-gilligans-island-1991.content: It would be beyond awesome to see the raw footage from the event that Wade apparently has...people have been talking about that footage for years...it's been almost 30 since the event!!! How about release just a few snippets of what he's got to quench our thirst and drum up some support for whatever doc he's working on??? Seems like a no brainer.  I'm actually a little worried about the raw footage...because uh...we were out of our freaking minds that night hahahahaha!! But the MTV footage that aired was fucking PERFECT!!! We can sit around and wait for some (raw footage) that might exist....or somebody can be a LEGEND and hook us up with that short MTV clip. I'm happy to discuss a cash reward for your generosity.

markem-x-acid-indigestion.author: Jake
markem-x-acid-indigestion.content:
Attention Josh & Jason...

I cannot begin to thank you guys for you contributions to this extraordinary website. This tape was a life changing experience for me back in those days and having this tape again brings so much joy to me. This era was the greatest in our generation of electronic dance music in my view. This tape is the true essence of acid house and I am truly grateful to you guys for posting this up. Again, many thanks..

markem-x-acid-indigestion.author: CMPINMSP

markem-x-acid-indigestion.author: Jared
markem-x-acid-indigestion.content:
@Josh..... Didn't Middle Earth have numerous locations? I remember promoting for it when they moved to OC locations, and attending it at various different locations for a while. It was the weekly that eventually moved locations :) It was a great club though. The loops they had were rad. Not to mention the dj's.
Josh McClintock: I had the pleasure of Djing with Markem X at a little weekly club in and around Long Beach called “Middle Earth” along with David Alvarado and Frank C in ’93. Not only is Markem a great Dj but he is also funny as ^%&*!!! We had some really good times….was sad when he moved away.

markem-x-acid-indigestion.author: Josh McClintock
markem-x-acid-indigestion.content: The guy that threw the parties name was Tom...forget his last name. Really motivated cool guy,he was really good at finding locations.One of the really cool thing about the party was that it WAS in a different location every week. Tom also dj'd as well (very well too I must say) The loops were done by M and C productions which was my best friend Jim Hamner and Mark Veltman. They did visuals at many parties....the best one in my opinion being Technoflight at the Sprucegoose where they had all there loops over the huge hull of the actual Sprucegoose (the one loop that sticks in my mind the most is where Catwoman is licking Batman) They were very talented. Mark Veltman went on to become a very succesfull fashion photographer.You can see some of his work at MarkVeltman.com

markem-x-acid-indigestion.author: Jared
markem-x-acid-indigestion.content: Yeah, Alien Tom... dude was really fucking cool.  I remember the techno flight party, that was rad.

markem-x-acid-indigestion.author: Memories!!!!!!!
markem-x-acid-indigestion.content: I am so !@##$%  happy to finally find my mixing partner! I remember throwing down ridiculous mixing sessions at that same club in Long beach with Josh and Markem! Its so cool to see those old school mixed tapes! yes, its Joey Dread!!!!! I miss you bro!!!!

n2o-lifes-a-gassssss.author: DJ N2O
n2o-lifes-a-gassssss.content:
GOOD NEWS!!!!

I finally got off my lazy (_l_) and got most of my mix CD's up on Mixcloud. Here's the link: https://www.mixcloud.com/dj_n2o/
These are all mix CD's that I never released, so enjoy! :) I'm going to try and get the remainder of my DJ tapes up on there too.

Larry, unfortunately I don't have a track listing for the Losing My Mind tape.  Normally I would write the tracks down before recording, but there were a few recordings where I was just "winging it". I just listened to that tape recently and I'm kicking myself for not writing the tracks down. The only track I know for sure is the first track on side A, which is Communique #11 - "Channeling". I'm going to put this tape on Mixcloud as well. Stay tuned.

DJ N2O (Brian)

circa-92.author: Pedro808

circa-92.author: Pedro808
circa-92.content: Oh yeah and it was all over the news.... lol.

circa-92.author: Mojo
circa-92.content: Yes Pedro, the production was out of this world. Remember the monitors with the visuals in the big speaker stack?

circa-92.author: Pedro808
circa-92.content: Yes! It was kind of surreal. You would be speaker jacking with a couple of hundred people behind you and you look up and there are all these crazy monitors with crazy visuals and to top off crazy ass lasers right above that. I still remember waiting outside and thinking the Shrines' doors were going to fall off from all the bass.

circa-92.author: Josh McClintock
circa-92.content:
27:40.....I use to bug Barry about this track all the time. My favorite track  that only he would play back in the day. i used to call it the "airplane" song...derrrr...I must have stumbled over to him half a dozen times....sometimes through heavy security...to ask the name of this track. And every time he would tell me the title too!!! Of course I would never remember what the fucking track was the next day.lol And what would a proper oldschool set by Barry Weaver be without sending the train in 57:40!!! Anybody know the track at 109:40?
   What a fantastic set this is here by Barry. Definitely showcasing his talents. Guy can MIX proper! And has a great ear for what sounds ill. Add in the Shrine....virgin location with $$$ put into it.....and all the other A+ dj's. Made for an incredible evening I must say. My only complaint...no paint room.  hahaha jk

circa-92.author: Cesar Alcantar
circa-92.content: Yo Josh, I remember that track at 27:49...it was a white label that I could never find....I used to drool over that cut when he would bust it ...too many memories..back then all I did every weekend was carry Barry's records around and block the decks when he played so the record wouldn't skip....that record played out into noise and he would always drop some bananas shit to it....damn, those were the days...and that train...signature Barry, which blew my mind when DJ Dan and Jim Hopkins bit that shit for their track Electroliners....as for that track at 109:40....who knows?

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-1.content:
Hey Josh,
It's been a few years since 1988! That was the year my world became flooded with dance records and Mixmag's weekly magazines. I used to drive to Melrose from the valley during my lunch our just for a chance to hunt vinyl for 10 minutes! Thanks for these mixes, your years of serving us music for our souls, for being active on this site,  and for all of the memories these classic mixes bring. 
Cheers M8!

If you would like to hear more of my stuff, please feel free to check out my Soundcloud page. I got a bunch of dope mixes there including this oldschool set you might like....Take care dude!!! http://soundcloud.com/josh-from-ny/welcome-to-the-pleasure-dome

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-1.content:
On it! 
It's true! I spent many an hour trying to find parking on those tight ass streets! I just drove through there the other week with some visitors from out of town and man, what an odd sense of sadness seeing none of my old haunts there anymore. 
No worries though, we've got more horizons to conquer!
Peace!

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-2.author: Josh McClintock
josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-2.content:
One night Shaggy? These werent even recorded on planet earth my brother.....lol Naw...I recorded the first one at the end of '93 and the third one at the end of '94....I shoulda wrote the dates on the tape...but thats my best guess. I put a lot of thought into the tapes....it wasnt just pop a tape in and lets party. I wanted it to play out like a story....with an intro and an ending that made it seem like a journey. I've been playing these in my car and they sound so nice and clean......Jason did a great job digitizing them.
   Looking forward to the third one being posted in the next couple weeks......the first side on it "Stairway to Heaven" is my favorite recording I have ever done. 
  Thanx again for the kind words Shaggy!

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-2.author: Josh McClintock
josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-2.content:
Thank you Shagola aka Shagmeister!!! There is a bit of my personal history in that mix...which will sadly explain the extra soulfullness of it. My father had passed away 4 hours prior to me playing that party. One of the last things he said to me was..."Play GOOD Friday." I somehow kept it together (with much help from my friends that were there....pretty sure you can hear them in the background at points.) and played a set that was straight up what I was feeling at the moment. I pretty much layed my heart and soul on the dancefloor.....we danced in celebration of my father and I dedicated the set and recording to him. Thank you for listening and appreciating it !!!
Tracklist
David Harness - Shake (Carlos G-Dubbs last track)
Burnski- Draw your Sword
Rhythm Plate-Don't Care about You
Moulton Studios - Get Back Up
CeCe Rogers -Someday
Paradise Inc. - Get Together Now
Alison Limerick - Where Love Lives
Sir James - Special
Intense - Holding On
Funky Disco and the New Groove - Oww
Eddie and the Eggs - Me and My Watermelon

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-2.author: Shahnam (a.k.a Shaggy)
josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-2.content:
I'm hearing you dawg! I'm touched to hear that. Well it was today Easter Sunday 1997. I was out all night candy-fliping at some party. Was supposed to go to Thousand oaks park with family. Was so burnt i did not attend. That day under the sunshine my popz had a heart attack & flew away...never to return. I cried for a month! even do now. I have letter from him that he had written to me. Till this day I can not get past the 1st sentence... 

I HEAR YOU CHAMP DEEP! you ever play in L.A. you need let me know CHAMP. 

HOLD ON STRONG CHIEF! We have Guardian Angels.

LOVE the USTREAM Josh - CHEERS to DAD!

HAPPY EASTER!

So I'm sure our paths have crossed. Feel free to friend request me on Facebook if you havent already dude! I post tracks and mixes on my page all the time. I hope you have a good Easter...enjoy your day bro!

PEACE BROTHER!

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-3.author: Josh McClintock
josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-3.content: Thanks guys! This is actually the last tape I recorded before I moved to NY in early '96. I'm really proud of all 3 tapes but the first side of this one is my personal favorite. I used to have this really cool boombox that I would take everywhere with me (the beach,parking lot of a party,mountains) this tape got a lot of play on that ol thing. BIG THANK YOU again to Jason here at SIMFONIK for digitizing these and posting them up on this AMAZING site! I would also like to let you know that Jason has asked me to do an ACID JUNKY 4 especially for the site. I've almost completed it...and when I do I'll send it in. June, July most likely. I decided to keep in the spirit of things and record it to tape.....i am having a hard time finding actual NICE tapes to buy though hahahaha! Also...I have about 10k more records than when I put out AJ3....so selecting records for it was quite the process. Fun as &^%$ though I must admit! Thank you to everyone that gave these a listen.....back then ..and now. Enjoy!

xavier-live-at-opium-8-12-95.author: Devious
xavier-live-at-opium-8-12-95.content: this was my first REAL rave. I was with the sound production crew Master Splinter and THX. I got a chance to do an opening set in the hardcore arena... When shit got outta hand and the kids broke the fence in the hardcore arena, we were on top of the speaker stacks holding the bobbed wired fence back.. who remembers this??? oh those were the days, I've never been the same... I also got sprayed in the face with MACE by some security guys all while on 2 black pyramids.... guud tymes

xavier-live-at-opium-8-12-95.author: Loneraver
xavier-live-at-opium-8-12-95.content: Wow! I can't believe there is a recording of this!! This was an amazing night. I will never forget those lasers, the castle, golf course, the hardcore room, the techno room with Xavier! I met so many friends here. Thank you, thank you for uploading this.

I had a mix tape from 91/92 had dildo, put on ur raving shoes and boarding a plane touchdown in middle of pouring rain, oh nana nana oh nana “think was 2 unlimited” that song anyway. But also had kali mah exchatiti from temples of doom,the original techno tetris song, think may had elevator up n down but mnew had praga khan injected w a poison and 9mm but pretty sure was a 90/120 min tape and had the baddest shit ive ever heard together” may have ahd smart es on it, think had dcruz life ohh and i remmeber at end of one side had born to be alive “disco” i believe. If anyone knows the mix tape please hook it up n dj please.

powertools-10-24-92.author: Shahnam (a.k.a Shaggy)
powertools-10-24-92.content:
HUGE DISCOGRAPHY!!!!!!! THANK YOU FOR THIS POST..... SURE DOES BRING BACK MEMORIES.

what I'm abut to say is true & came be taken to some as quite controversial.

Back in the day there were two sides the “Religion: true under ground nation” and then came new & up coming "ravers" who collected flyers and so on. Me and much of my underground colleagues hated when we started to hear the underground sound going commercial! We felt ever since Powertools started playing out the UDG started to go south! by 1994 true UDG parties were all gone and taken over by RAVERS!

Parties in mansions, barns, broken into warehouses, the foothills with pulsating LAZERS and towers of speakers --- all disappeared when Techno went commercial, Thanks to radio.

Mars FM could not compete with the bigger station, they tried to stay and keep it underground, but got eaten up eventually by POWERTOOLS. Listening to Mars FM was like trying to tune into a frequency out of space....it was great! 

AHHH I miss those exciting wide eye days!

That's my 2 cents & I guess is for all.

“Bass is thumpin here a little something to bring down the wall.”

PEACE – The TRUE and ORIGINAL SHAGGY.

ONELUV

powertools-10-24-92.author: Josh McClintock
powertools-10-24-92.content: Shaggy...I totally agree with you. I was on the underground side of the argument as well. I felt Powertools was wayyyy too commercial back then. The mixes were tight but the house was cheeseball.....I'm shocked to see Jon Williams and Eli Star in the mix here on the show. You were more likely to hear Hardrive - Deep Inside or  Sound Factory - Understand this groove for the millionth time. Hey...they did make A LOT of people happy and inspired a shit load of Dj's.....not my cup of tea though. Much rather listen too Mars FM, or Jason Bentley, or KUCI in Irvine.

powertools-10-24-92.author: Pedro808
powertools-10-24-92.content: Alot of the old skool underground cats played PT. Moonopup, Aldo Bender, Doc and some other ones. Personally I hated Power Tools and their whole staff. They were pompous and acted like they were the creators of the scene. New jacks. When they were playing freestyle at Black Angus we (OG Underground) were rocking out on Santa Fe. Music was cool but they pulled a lot of gimmicks to deceive their listeners, like their fake on the scene rave reports when they were actually in Jerry Merazs garage. F them dudes.

powertools-10-24-92.author: Mike
powertools-10-24-92.content:
I like that it's up here. Was I a fan of KPWR or Power 106? No! I did appreciate the fact that a lot of my favorite DJs were able to play and get exposure to an audience that might not have heard them otherwise. I'm more of a fan of music than "scenes". Along with all of the bad music that unquestionably got played on Power Tools, there was also an incredible amount of pure class music played by some of LA's true underground DJ's --- like RAW, DJ TRANCE, MOONPUP, ALDO BENDER, DOC MARTIN, STEVE LORIA, BARRY WEAVER, etc... I think there's an importance to capture everything, be it good or bad. 

Peace!

powertools-10-24-92.author: DustOne
powertools-10-24-92.content:
So, what you guys are saying is, that if Powertools didn't exist, then the LA rave scene would have never gone mainstream?  I call bullshit.  Like Nature Boy said "All those social movements get swallowed up after a couple good years. It’s inevitable that ego moves in and destroys the true spirit."  If something is fun and exciting chances are that eventually it's going to catch on with alot of people and get commercialized.  Just the way the world is...
You can't blame an enthusiastic Power 106 employee for trying to help his DJ friends by getting them exposure by playing on the radio.

powertools-10-24-92.author: Mike
powertools-10-24-92.content:
MarsFM wasn't any more underground than PowerTools. Both were accessible via the dial on my radio anyway, and I can only assume that was the case for everyone else in Los Angeles. Call me a conspiracy theorist but I suspect both were also run for the purpose of making money -- a business, if you will. 

If you're going to hate on one radio show for playing and promoting electronic music, you should hate on them all. While you're at it, you should also hate on all the record shops that advertised on those stations and had visible storefronts, where undesirables could discover our "underground scene"... I mean, after all, they weren't underground if kids from Fairfax High could walk down the street and get exposed to "our music" and "our scene" via the records that were playing and the flyers that were in plain sight. 

Like DustOne, I also call bullshit.

powertools-10-24-92.author: Mojo

Shaggy, you went to Chatsworth? I went to Canoga... small world. =)

I believe Simfonik has posted enough other quality material on here that we all should be grateful for, so I hope everyone can just take a step back and let the man do his thing. I totally understand where everyone is coming from on this... on all sides. But at the end of the day, it's about the music. And if Simfonik believes these tapes are worthy of posting, then I support that 100%.

powertools-10-24-92.author: Shahnam (a.k.a Shaggy)
powertools-10-24-92.content:
"Like Nature Boy said “All those social movements get swallowed up after a couple good years. It’s inevitable that ego moves in and destroys the true spirit.”

speaking from experience. The L.A underground scene was strong and taboo from 1988 to 1992. STRONG! 

That's 4 years right there that i know of. Who knows what was before 1988 as i was just a kid!

Appointed by Executives, producers and Trend Analysts in early 90' they saw the evolution in Techno not "EDM" and leaped to expolite the sound.. To be the first to expose this musical Taboo we called techno all over the airway. Forcing other pirate radio stations to come out so they can keep a portion of the scene real, hidden, something to call our own and away from the commercial "EDM" being.

People thought techno was crazy and it was taboo back then.

That shit went strong underground for a long time...Not just 2 years... 

So yes i do feel strongly that PT and their power of influence over a small private scene in L.A.

But it was inevitable. Thug executives are mad strong in the industry! MARS never had a chance, and if it wasn't for the public support & local paid sponsors KCRW would not have lasted either.

I'm not here to ruffles anyones feathers,  i'm just standing up for what i believed in.  And by 94-95 was dead. This aint no Sinamatic, Goth, or Breakin that left as fast as it came.  The scene was strong for many years until it got commercialized by you know who.

PLEASE don't forget to drop a dime in the donation bucket 8)

PEACE;
Shagyola

powertools-10-24-92.author: Andy Bratz
powertools-10-24-92.content: I did not really support this show in the day as I was usually still in a warehouse or vacant building until 4:00 Am, BUT it was great to have this station (Show) sometimes as my tape player in my Hooptie did not work all the time and I did not always have my box with me. If you took away what I did from going to all the true undergrounds like Paw Paw Patch and anything from the beginning of the Bat Line you would accept this POST  for what it was and not what it wasnt! I drove from Ventura County "Camarillo" weekend after weekend and even weekdays (from 1989 to 1993ish) for the openess and LOVE and the freedom to be who I wanted to be and not who I was not. I remember a later one called Fresh Fruit (they gave out free fruit) and it seemed to be the last REAL LOVE underground I went to other than seeing DOC on the wednesday night of the L.A. riots in the back of a industial park - that was an awesome night/morning! My point is if you where a TRUE believer of the underground you would want to share this music with anyone who liked it and you would not judge it when it got to "Commercial" but accept where it went and that more and more people liked it and it opened the eyes of millions to this type of music, vibe and culture. I love house, trance and anything DOC does and I am who I am today because of this type of music including Power Tools! POSITIVITY RULES

powertools-10-24-92.author: Jay
powertools-10-24-92.content:
Its this simple. Los Angeles had no electronic music radio outlets at that time unless you were in the scene and or a dj who bought vinyl. There was no mp3, internet, simifonik, soulseek etc. Mixtapes even were still fairly underground prior to the mid-90s. So.....like it or not, Powertools and Marsfm both played commercial shit. I used to record all powertools live on tapes cuz there was no other large variety of Los Angeles Djs & a few outer towners sets available, only cd compilations which were mainly europe style hardcore still. If you stayed up long enough till 3-4am ( yes powertools used to be on for more then 2 hours) they played a lot of underground acid, techno, & some random mixtapes that werent commercial. Dj Orlando, Thee-o, Trance frequently were on, live or by tape. Them dudes played nothing commercial....

But agree, its all about the underground

powertools-10-24-92.author: Nolving

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Frank
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: Nice! this is a rare classic tape from e-zone one of my favorite dj's from that time.I believe this was the demo for the shivas erotic banquet party @the casa which went off proper.We got a copy of this from Julio of savage house prod. i lost mine,,good lookin out J Splat for holding onto yours and Simfonik for putting this up.

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Mickey

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Jason Splat
dj-e-zone-3-92.content:
Sweet to see this got uploaded. It was one of my favorite techno tapes. 
Thanks for the back story Frank, I forgot where the tape came from, doh! 

Shivas was amazing, The Casa never went off that hard again IMO. Timothy Leary upstairs was surreal. 

Julio from Savage House was a supercool dude, I wonder what became of him?

Anyways Jason- I got a ton more old tapes off that list I sent, let me know if you want me to digitize some more.

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: 1of 3
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: Shiva's was epic but Aphrodites Temple had the real live love vibe so thick you had to swim through it. Doc Martin, Ron D Core, a little known dj by the name of DJ Dan, and a random assortment of others, even E-zone. Does shit go off like that any more? I had an E-Zone tape that was my favorite for 7 years (when the tape broke) Wow thanks for bringing me back, This shit kills me.

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: travis vs
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: So good to hear these songs again. E-zone definatley has some trax on this mix that don't show up again. Mixing is Faboo for it's time too! RspKT!

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Chris

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: pearl

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Hans

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Hans
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: Pearl, I remember Eric juggling his party & school life too! Used to come to our after parties where nobody left in study condition lol! Anyone here remember the party at  The Citadel? Cant recall the name. Nice outdoor venue though.

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Aphrodites Survivor

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Hans
dj-e-zone-3-92.content:
Speaking of Ron... still going strong. My first mixtape  of his was Hot Lemonade. I think it was 91. "Jack of Clubs!!!"

Anyone remember that? I'm gonna call him at the shoppe this week and see if he has it digitized on mp3.

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Josh
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: I contributed 3 of the 4 Hot Lemonade Tapes to this site. Including the one with the "Jack of Clubs". After a couple weeks Ron got pissed and demanded them to be taken down. He promised that he would put them up on his own site but never did. Sucks. They were sloppy sure...but historic nonetheless. Among the first tapes I brought home with me along with "Acid Hits" and the "Milky Way" tapes.

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Hans
dj-e-zone-3-92.content:
That's too bad about Hot Lemonade. Yeah. They were raw tapes. Maybe he wants to be known for something other than "we all start  somewhere." They are part of history, however.

Ron, i know you're reading this.  Let it fly, man!

Josh, thanks for being such a consistent participant on this forum, advocate for the scene, and terrific DJ.

Cheers!

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Hans
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: never trust  someone who calls themself the "west coast hardcore pervert."

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Josh
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: Thanks Hans!! I got big respect for Ron. Just wished he would have left his recordings on this site alone. He had a lot of fans that were enjoying them.

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Zack
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: Agreed... I chased that tape (my first introduction to dj mixtapes in 1991) for 20+ years before Josh submitted it! Glad I was able to grab them before he pulled them down.

dj-e-zone-3-92.author: Craig Ellenwood
dj-e-zone-3-92.content: I was the sound tech for Psychic TV at Shiva’s Erotic Banquet. Hottest rave ever. Sweat dripping from everything. A week later the Rodney King incident happened near the warehouse where Shiva’s was held and the riots started right there too. I often think how lucky we were that the rave wasn’t a week later.

circa-94.author: Shahnam (a.k.a Shaggy)
circa-94.content:
HARDCORE COME ALIVE~

The most impressive, baddest, tuffest opening You will here in along time. His sounds is way beyond it's time! AMAZING absolutely Amazing.

DAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAM. 

He dropping that shit @ 10:27. Not only he blew up this track but killed the nexxx one as well.

HOLD ON TIGHT - DON'T LOOK BACK -

Could do without the Mickey Finn sounding dude pop in and out. He sounds like he been hittin ballooons 8)

Set is definitely more on the Acid-Trance tip rather then Hard-Floor.  

J- you tagged correctly.. I don't even see hard-floor there!

Great for driving back early morning from Double Hit Mickey this weekend all zoooted.

Fuckin LOVE IT ~ THANK YOU T/J very much!

moonpup-stranded-on-gilligans.author: dom t
moonpup-stranded-on-gilligans.content: to put the record straight, the british invasion was down to mainly 3 dj's, myself DomT, Mark lewis and Michael Cook.The highlite of Gilligans Island was in 2 parts, the 1st was me pushing Moonpup backwards over his record box for having a tantrum about wanting to play next (sorry about that) the 2nd was a tune each set shared by moi and the great Doc Martin as the sun came up on the beach, my record box was on the dance floor of which when I needed a tune I wobbled on to the floor, grabbed it then played it.the tune that killed it was "barefoot in the head" lastly the guy that missed the boat that day was a loon by the name of "dave seven" if you were ther that much you'll know! good times, and good memories even if they are cloudy.peace DomT
