Just curious on what you thought in how it came out? Whats your favorite part of the tape? I Really enjoy listening to your audio-trips.

Thank You.

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-4.author: Josh McClintock
josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-4.content:
O Man....I had a lot of fun making this tape!!! Took a little longer than expected. Lot of things went wrong during the process....Had to get new needles.....replace scratched records...new time consuming job...etc etc...The hardest part was actually selecting the tracks because my vinyl collection is enormous these days. In the end...I think it came out pretty good. I'm a perfectionist so there is always something I think I could do better on it....but I'm content with the way it turned out.
     The first side is my favorite and also gave me the most troubles. My favorite parts are the "Euphorhythm with the "my house" acapella over it..as well as the mix out of it with MDM. And the 2 Fast Eddie tracks just melted together perfectly.
  Really happy with the second side as well....The mix out of " House Nation" to Ikko being my fave.. And the ending to side 2 with "Acid Bitch" was perfect.

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-4.author: Josh McClintock
josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-4.content: I would also like to say a BIG thank you to Jason here at Simfonik for asking me to do this. It was an honor and a lot of fun! Also THANK YOU to George Menjivar for the artwork and Vanessa Becerra for the oldschool photo!

josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-4.author: Josh McClintock
josh-mcclintock-acid-junky-vol-4.content:
Actually Vanessa...I ended up recording this digitally. I tried doing it by tape...it sounded horrible. So I figured....he's just gonna transfer it to digital anyways..so I bought a nice little Tascam recorder and did it on that. And yes..it was all vinyl.
     Thanks  for the love guys! Take care

mr-buzz-acid-hits-14.author: Josh
mr-buzz-acid-hits-14.content: Buzz!! We used to hang all the time back in the early days.  Awesome dude. We would go to the Casa, Flammable Liquid, all the big parties together. He even came to my graduation party with my family when I graduated high school! I'd get so excited when he came out with a new tape.  Acid Hits 9 was the first tape I brought home with me from the parties.  I think it was E.S.P or Synergy at the Casa in early 1991 where I bought it off him for $5.  His MEGA MIX special editions  were the shit!!! We kinda had a falling out and after I moved to NY in 1996 I lost touch with him. I've looked for him for years but can't seem to find him. I have a large amount of his tapes (32) that need to get posted up someday. I saw that somebody just posted up Acid Hits 9 on You Tube. Sick!!

mr-buzz-acid-hits-14.author: Zack Hill
mr-buzz-acid-hits-14.content:
Josh was kind enough to ship his entire Mr. Buzz collection over for archiving. I'm working my way through them quickly and we'll get them posted soon. They're sounding great so far - Kudos to Josh for keeping them in such good shape!

That said.. how do we find Mr. Buzz so he can share his stories?? Any leads?

barry-weaver-1991.author: Barry Weaver
barry-weaver-1991.content:
Thanks Josh for passing this "lost" mix over to Jason and thanks Jason for posting the mix! Uh, Josh, I'd love to know the story behind how Therese ended up with a copy of this mix. Yes, it's definitely me! And I totally remember making this mix too - the Le Mystère Des Voix Bulgares meets Moody Blues on the first side intro and that Self Help record at the start of side two are trademark "me", as is the use of the train. Also, the "it's not over, it's____over" (from one of those DMC Loops And Grooves volumes) trick at the end of side two is a dead giveaway...
I have no idea why it was not released, or what my intention was for this mix. I couldn't begin to tell you what it was going to be called. If I had to make a guess I'd say it might have been intended as a next Milky Way tape, but I'm not really sure. Hell, I wouldn't have been able to even pinpoint the year I made it, so if you say 1991, I'll buy that! Oh, and thanks guys for IDing most of the tracks! Appreciate it.

barry-weaver-1991.author: Josh McClintock
barry-weaver-1991.content: Awesome backstory to the mix. Thank you Barry! That Le Mystere track is so beautiful! I will have to ask Therese how she got this mix!!! hahaha Pretty sure it was a close friend of yours gave it to her.

josh-mcclintock-kuci-riders-of-the-plast.author: Mojo
josh-mcclintock-kuci-riders-of-the-plast.content: Wow, tasty tracklistings. Will check these out for sure! This is crazy Josh, because I did a show for Riders back in '93, must have been around the same time. That was back when Joaquin (sp?) was running the show right? I just find it funny because it's another time when our paths almost crossed back in the day.

josh-mcclintock-kuci-riders-of-the-plast.author: Josh
josh-mcclintock-kuci-riders-of-the-plast.content: Joakim was extremely cool guy. He really appreciated the DJ's and the music. I wonder what he's up to these days? Do you have any of your old recordings from this show? I hope you enjoy the mixes dude!

josh-mcclintock-kuci-riders-of-the-plast.author: omar
josh-mcclintock-kuci-riders-of-the-plast.content: I really enjoyed both sets and, it's always nice to hear a dope DJ who is doing it for all the right reasons.

josh-mcclintock-kuci-riders-of-the-plast.author: Mojo
josh-mcclintock-kuci-riders-of-the-plast.content: Yeah, he was cool. He's on Facebook, I tried to reach out to him, in part becuase I wanted to see if there was an archive of the old show, but he hasn't responded. I think he's moved on. Which I understand. I know I'm gonna dig these mixes. I've thoroughly enjoyed everything I've heard from you to date. Keep up the great work man!

best party I saw you at was at a Rollerink with the movie Akira's motorcycle scene looping as the visuals- fat wall of sound and killer vibe.

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.author: Mojo
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content: Thank you everyone for the wonderful feedback and support. And a huge thanks to Simfonik for everything he's done for all of us who appreciate the nostalgia and memories he has allowed to live on here. I will never forget my roots, nor the magic times that laid down those roots. Peace and light!

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.author: Ol'Skool Adam
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content:
Joey, you are truly under rated/paid. last i checked there are DJs charging a grip for their tracks and even more for their mixes. you know, crap ass DJs like the 'illSkra, and the dead mice... and a couple of pauls and teistacle.. you blow those wannaBjs off the dance floor... 
my big issue is which epic mix is my favorite? unlike DX1-3 and all classic tapes from my collection. yours shit never gets old or played out!!!  Un-fucken-believable. Cant wait for epic IV.

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.author: Mojo
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content: Thanks Adam. Really appreciate the kind words and all the support over the years.

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.author: Hans
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content: Excellent Old Skool mix. Takes me back to 92. Love it. Got most of this stuff at Street Sounds on Melrose in the dayz!

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.author: Hans
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content: The more I listen to this the more I hear you mixing and not just cutting over to the next track which was so prevalent in original techno (whatever genre) music. Great job!

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content: Thanks Hans. I wonder if you're the Hans I'm thinking of. If so, what's up man? Been a minute. =)

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.author: Hans
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content: Most likely! If it was a happenin' we was a there!

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.author: Milktoast
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content:
Wow Joel you really didn't miss a beat, you pretty much covered them all in this one.Very nice work. It would be even better if you had the mix mastered to bring out the original fidelity of that old wax.Please don't misunderstand this is in no way a criticism.
Thanks for your hard work and devotion to a scene and sound we can only daydream about 20 years later.

dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.author: Mojo
dj-mojo-an-epic-oldskool-journey-part-3.content: Hi Milktoast, nice to hear from you and I appreciate the kind words. Thanks for the feedback; although, I did master the mix. Of course, mastering can be somewhat subjective, so I do not take it as criticism in the slightest. I'm very happy that you enjoyed it! Always good to hear from DJs that  have stayed true and represented from back in the day. Respect to you. =)
